channel.title: CMPT 379: Compilers, Instructor: Anoop Sarkar
channel.description: Announcements related to the SFU course CMPT 379: Compilers, Fall 2006, taught by Anoop Sarkar

item.description: Parsing demos using Python-based nltk toolkit are available on course web page. To extract files run "ar -x nltk_demos.ar". You will need to install nltk-lite (nltk) and other required packages to be able to run the demos.
Guide to MIPS assembly available on course web page. You will find it useful for HW5.
Quiz #2 to held on Mon, Nov 6th. Topics to be covered are listed on the course web page.
Added sample code to help you understand dynamic linking in unix. To extract files run "ar -x dylib.ar"
Notes #3 has been changed slightly. Please note this when comparing mailing list discussion with page numbers to the notes.
Quiz #1 will be held on Mon, Oct 2. It will be closed book, in class, and so 50 mins long. Topics 1 and 2 from the syllabus listed on the course web page.
There is a 2006 edition of the Dragon book that was very recently released. Please do not purchase this book as I haven't had time to adjust the course materials to the new book.
The teaching assistant for CMPT 379, Eric Dagenais, will be in the CSIL labs between 3-4pm on Thursdays.
Quiz #1 will be held in class on Mon, Oct 2, 2006
Homework #1, due date Sep 18, 2006. Relevant files are in ~anoop/cmpt379/hw1 on CSIL linux machines
Office hours posted: Wednesdays from 2-3pm at TASC 9427
